data.title: The Meadville Tribune
data.meta_description: Kevin Schreffler passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Meadville Tribune on 2021-11-03.
data.text:
Kevin K. Schreffler, 55, of Meadville, passed away, Tuesday, November 2, 2021 at home. He was born on November 22, 1965 in Meadville, a son of Merle E. and Fae L. Abbott Schreffler.

He enjoyed hunting, fishing, playing cards and chess, riding go-karts, playing in pool tournaments with his brother, Dean, and was brilliant at building engines. He built bridges with his brother, Gibb when employed with the Labor Union.

Kevin was a member of the American Legion 111 and American Legion 205.

He is survived by his father, Merle Schreffler of Meadville; three sisters, Karen L. Frabotta of Meadville, Sharon T. Schrantz and her husband, David of Fredonia, New York, and Bridget E. Sheasley and her husband, Gary of Meadville; and three brothers, Dean P. Schreffler and his wife, Christine of Meadville, Randy L. Schreffler of Meadville, and Gibb E. Schreffler and his companion, Michelle Jackson of Cochranton.

Kevin is preceded in death by his mother, Fae; his companion, Patt Bisbee on October 11, 2021; a niece, Elaina Schreffler; a nephew, Brandon Schreffler; and two great-nephews, Kaiden Schrantz and Michael Moore.

Family and friends are welcome to call on Friday, November 5, 2021 from 2:00 pm to 4:00 pm at Ryan M. Warren Funeral Home and Cremation Services, Inc., 544 Chestnut Street, Meadville.

He will be laid to rest in Anderson Cemetery, Cochranton, Pennsylvania.

Please take a moment to share a memory or condolence on Kevin's Book of Memories online at www.WarrenFH.com.K.

Published on November 3, 2021

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
